channel.title: KenSmith tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from KenSmith.

item.description: Pence, ordinarily spineless, had one good day, then reverted to form. https://t.co/a5Yu6I4hb3
item.source:markdown: Pence, ordinarily spineless, had one good day, then reverted to form. https://t.co/a5Yu6I4hb3

item.description: How to Drive a Mars Rover – not what you'd expect in the least. https://t.co/mvkNwmx8ib
item.source:markdown: How to Drive a Mars Rover – not what you'd expect in the least. https://t.co/mvkNwmx8ib

item.description: One weekend day each week, ten miles of road passing through a park-rich, diverse, and food-happy part of town will be open only to bicyclists and pedestrians. Bonus points for street murals or fireworks. https://t.co/9x3x0jXIy6 https://t.co/AVGminp10b
item.source:markdown: One weekend day each week, ten miles of road passing through a park-rich, diverse, and food-happy part of town will be open only to bicyclists and pedestrians. Bonus points for street murals or fireworks. https://t.co/9x3x0jXIy6 https://t.co/AVGminp10b

item.description:
Recipe for some @NewYorker covers: the massive scale of the city, perhaps beautiful, perhaps edgy, but including a quiet detail of someone whose person-sized portion of it happily, sweetly, even movingly works. https://t.co/W2RDNFcQjL

And sometimes there is a glimpse of the natural world tucked into the big-scale city scene. https://t.co/ywjcHC63c0
item.source:markdown:
Recipe for some @NewYorker covers: the massive scale of the city, perhaps beautiful, perhaps edgy, but including a quiet detail of someone whose person-sized portion of it happily, sweetly, even movingly works. https://t.co/W2RDNFcQjL
And sometimes there is a glimpse of the natural world tucked into the big-scale city scene. https://t.co/ywjcHC63c0

item.description: @mmildenberger @drvolts Thank you. It's always good to find another story of people trying to have their say about the shape of their civic life.
item.source:markdown: @mmildenberger @drvolts Thank you. It's always good to find another story of people trying to have their say about the shape of their civic life.

item.description: @mmildenberger @drvolts Have you written about this somewhere?
item.source:markdown: @mmildenberger @drvolts Have you written about this somewhere?

item.description: Smiling as you walk past a tractor is not the same as creating a sound national farm and food policy. By @HerdyShephard1, James Rebanks. https://t.co/fQ3J0PPEZP
item.source:markdown: Smiling as you walk past a tractor is not the same as creating a sound national farm and food policy. By @HerdyShephard1, James Rebanks. https://t.co/fQ3J0PPEZP

item.description: Howard Brody wrote that medical experts must understand, accept and own up to the responsibilities of their healing & social powers, and must aim those powers in service, not self-aggrandizement, by sharing the power knowingly with patients. @AnnaDeForest hits related notes here. https://t.co/uXl2QBR5Pu
item.source:markdown: Howard Brody wrote that medical experts must understand, accept and own up to the responsibilities of their healing & social powers, and must aim those powers in service, not self-aggrandizement, by sharing the power knowingly with patients. @AnnaDeForest hits related notes here. https://t.co/uXl2QBR5Pu

item.description: Dr. Anna DeForest speaks and writes about the unacknowledged social power of expert healers, as Howard Brody might have put it. https://t.co/az2ESZivGB
item.source:markdown: Dr. Anna DeForest speaks and writes about the unacknowledged social power of expert healers, as Howard Brody might have put it. https://t.co/az2ESZivGB

item.description:
In "Being Mortal," @Atul_Gawande tells true stories of medical episodes and shows ways doctors commonly assume power over decisions about crisis and decline that rightfully belong to the patient.

Read this book in order to defend yourself.

https://t.co/9AmfzbELdN
item.source:markdown:
In "Being Mortal," @Atul_Gawande tells true stories of medical episodes and shows ways doctors commonly assume power over decisions about crisis and decline that rightfully belong to the patient.
Read this book in order to defend yourself.
https://t.co/9AmfzbELdN

item.description: Why some in the state's GOP think the new anti-abortion law in Indiana didn't go far enough. Having gerrymandered the party a veto-proof supermajority in both chambers of the legislature, the views of this wing of the party may someday prevail. https://t.co/9WgJgAeofW
item.source:markdown: Why some in the state's GOP think the new anti-abortion law in Indiana didn't go far enough. Having gerrymandered the party a veto-proof supermajority in both chambers of the legislature, the views of this wing of the party may someday prevail. https://t.co/9WgJgAeofW

item.description: A few days ago, I sat on the 18th floor deck of a building in lower Manhattan, nursing a seltzer with a twist of lime. In the nearest building, to the left, many lights were on. I could see identical paintings hanging in identical places on the walls of room after room. https://t.co/7R0D7oRHX9
item.source:markdown: A few days ago, I sat on the 18th floor deck of a building in lower Manhattan, nursing a seltzer with a twist of lime. In the nearest building, to the left, many lights were on. I could see identical paintings hanging in identical places on the walls of room after room. https://t.co/7R0D7oRHX9

item.description: @edsilverman Eli Lilly has also made the press release difficult to find. I'm trying to write about it but can't readily locate a copy I can rely on as accurate there on the company website.
